name: ProjectOrder
comment: Stores the fulfillment internal orders for the main customer order. Based on the grouping specifications, main order can be decomposed into sub orders or group of sub orders. If the order is fragmented, then this entity contains multiple rows for each customer order, along with the main order as separate row. This entity also stores the version details for the order.
vf short description: Stores the fulfillment internal orders for the main customer order. Based on the grouping specifications, main order can be decomposed into sub orders or group of sub orders.

fields.name: ProjectOrderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: ProjectOrderKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier in aLDM, for the order records in the fulfillment area. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.ENTITY_ID//Generated Key based on Service Order Id

fields.name: RootProjectOrderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: InternalOrderId
fields.comment: Identifies the internal order that has been created against the external customer order. Internal order version is used to create the order execution plan. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.INTERNAL_ORDER_ID

fields.name: InternalOrderVersionId
fields.comment: Indicates the version of the internal order Id. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.INTERNAL_ORDER_VERSION

fields.name: ProjectOrderId
fields.comment: An order can be fragmented into multiple order items. Each order item contains a unique order item ID. The Service Order ID stores the internal order ID and the order item ID. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.ENTITY_ID

fields.name: ActiveFlag
fields.comment: Specifies whether the service order is active. Default value is 0. For amend orders, the pre-existing Ids are used. For the rest of the service orders, the Id is 1. CASE WHEN ODO_ORDER_ITEM.IS_ACTIVE IS NULLTHEN ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.IS_ACTIVEELSE ODO_ORDER_ITEM.IS_ACTIVE IS NULLEND

fields.name: SystemId
fields.comment: Specifies the system Id for the service order. For internal orders, this value is set to ODO, and notifications are not sent for it. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.SYSTEM_ID

fields.name: OssCreationDate
fields.comment: Specifies the service order record creation date in the source system. CASE WHEN ODO_ORDER_ITEM.CREATION_DATE IS null THEN ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.CREATION_DATEELSE ODO_ORDER_ITEM.CREATION_DATEEND

fields.name: PreviousActiveOrderVersionId
fields.comment: Specifies the previous active order version. This field displays null value for order version 1 or rejected orders. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.PREVIOUS_ACTIVE_ORDER_VERSION

fields.name: FragmentedOrderFlag
fields.comment: Flag that indicates if the order is fragmented. The values are:1 = Fragmented Order0 = Regular Order CASE WHEN ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.BUCKET = "FrgOrder" THEN 1ELSE 0END//Please validate value during implementation.

fields.name: RootProjectOrderFlag
fields.comment: An attribute that indicates if the Order is the root order or fragmented order. The values are:1 = Root Order0 = Fragmented Order //Populated by ETL hard coded values://When processing from ODO_ORDER_ITEM, populate 0 , else 1

fields.name: ProjectOrderActionTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ServiceRequestedDate
fields.comment: Specifies the date on which the service fulfillment has been requested. //Lookup in order object inside PAYLOAD using attribute serviceRequestedDate value

fields.name: CustomerSiteSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: FrameworkAgreementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: AddressSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ExternalOrderId
fields.comment: Identifies the external order. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.EXTERNAL_ORDER_ID

fields.name: ExternalOrderVersionId
fields.comment: Identifies the version of the external order. ODO_ORDER_ATTRIBUTES.EXTERNAL_ORDER_VERSION

fields.name: ExternalOrderSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ProjectOrderAdditionalInfo
fields.comment: Stores the order object as received from external ordering. This object contains additional information about the order. For example, action type and order id. OSS_CONTEXT_STORE.PAYLOAD

fields.name: SubOrderExternalOrderActionSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
